intro: Randia ovata, commonly known as the oval randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Randia ovata is often found in wetlands, swamps, and other moist habitats, where it thrives in humid conditions.
